attributes.action: Lower insurance price to an affordable amount for young drivers in London
attributes.additional_details: Insurance should be based on the amount of claims and crashes had not simply your age and location, this is ageism? Charging at least £400 a month purely as I am young when anyone else is maximum £400 a year. Very discriminatory, why allow young people to pass their test if you will make it impossible for everything else?
attributes.background: Young drivers in London are looking at spending at least £400 a month to insure any type of car just due to the fact they are young. I understand it should be a little more as they have recently got their licence but not as extortionate as it is.
